The image used in the claim shows a logo: WHO) alongside a stock photo of two scientists.
The Sinhala: language text overlay on the image translates to English as a recommendation to drink plenty of water and gargle it in the throat with salt mixed with warm water or vinegar to prevent Covid-19.
The claim was not supported by verified: according to a spokesperson for Sri Lanka's Health Promotion Bureau, who stated that there is no scientific basis for the claim and no cure for Covid-19. The WHO's official recommendations also do not include gargling water as a treatment for Covid-19.
